dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, you know, we always talk about the super-rich, right? And, uh, there's been some wild news this week about a family we all know.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, you know, we always talk about the super-rich, right? And, uh, there's been some wild news this week about a family we all know.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, you mean the Waltons? From Walmart? I saw something flash across my newsfeed about, like, a huge stock drop.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, you mean the Waltons? From Walmart? I saw something flash across my newsfeed about, like, a huge stock drop.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Even in the era of e-commerce, Walmart reported earnings that pleased Wall Street on Thursday morning, sending the companys stock up nearly 10% as of 1:15 p.m.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! I mean, it's pretty wild. As of Thursday, Jeff Bezos is now actually wealthier than the entire Walton family combined.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! I mean, it's pretty wild. As of Thursday, Jeff Bezos is now actually wealthier than the entire Walton family combined.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Seven members of the Walton family possess a fortune worth about $174 billion, compared to Bezos $155.8 billion net worth as of 1 p.m. eastern on Thursday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, that's a big shift! So, what happened? Was it just Walmart's latest earnings report?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, that's a big shift! So, what happened? Was it just Walmart's latest earnings report?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, um, Walmart's report was pretty dismal, and their stock, like, dropped nearly ten percent on Thursday. That alone wiped out thirteen billion dollars from the Waltons' collective fortune.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, um, Walmart's report was pretty dismal, and their stock, like, dropped nearly ten percent on Thursday. That alone wiped out thirteen billion dollars from the Waltons' collective fortune.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Walmart reported earnings that pleased Wall Street on Thursday morning, sending the companys stock up nearly 10% as of 1:15 p.m. That uptick in shares boosted the Waltons collective fortune by $13 billion on Thursday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Thirteen billion in *one day*? That's just... I can't even comprehend that kind of money.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Thirteen billion in one day? That's just... I can't even comprehend that kind of money.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I know, right? And, uh, it also meant Alice Walton, Sam Walton's only daughter, lost her title as the richest woman in the world.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, right? And, uh, it also meant Alice Walton, Sam Walton's only daughter, lost her title as the richest woman in the world.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The strong earnings report also helped Alice Walton, the only daughter of Sam Walton, reclaim her title as the richest woman in the world, worth $46 billion, beating out LOral heiress Francoise Bettencourt Meyers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, that's right! I remember her being up there for years. So, who took her place?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, that's right! I remember her being up there for years. So, who took her place?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's Francoise Bettencourt Meyers now, the L'Oréal heiress. Alice, uh, she's still worth like $46 billion, but it's less than before.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's Francoise Bettencourt Meyers now, the L'Oréal heiress. Alice, uh, she's still worth like forty six billion dollars, but it's less than before.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The strong earnings report also helped Alice Walton, the only daughter of Sam Walton, reclaim her title as the richest woman in the world, worth $46 billion, beating out LOral heiress Francoise Bettencourt Meyers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Which, still, is more money than I'll ever see, but it's a huge tumble from the top.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, still, is more money than I'll ever see, but it's a huge tumble from the top.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. But it really highlights Walmart's struggles. I mean, they're even downplaying their online catalog now, which seems, like, counter-intuitive in this e-commerce era.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. But it really highlights Walmart's struggles. I mean, they're even downplaying their online catalog now, which seems, like, counter-intuitive in this e-commerce era.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In its earnings announcement, Walmart drew attention to an expanded online catalog and pointed to a rapid increase in its grocery business

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and their grocery business too! They're actually cutting back on grocery delivery services in like, forty percent of America. It's almost like a surrender to Amazon.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and their grocery business too! They're actually cutting back on grocery delivery services in like, forty percent of America. It's almost like a surrender to Amazon.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: By the end of the year, Walmart said its grocery delivery service will be available in 40% of America, and its grocery pickup option is already in 1,800 locations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It does, doesn't it? Like, you'd think they'd be doubling down, not pulling back. It's a huge market.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It does, doesn't it? Like, you'd think they'd be doubling down, not pulling back. It's a huge market.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's just wild how much things have changed. Bezos is thriving, and Walmart, which used to be this unshakeable giant...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's just wild how much things have changed. Bezos is thriving, and Walmart, which used to be this unshakeable giant...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] ...is, uh, seeing its impact decay, as the article put it. It even had this, like, really sarcastic line at the end.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: ...is, uh, seeing its impact decay, as the article put it. It even had this, like, really sarcastic line at the end.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The fact that the Walton fortune is still bigger than Bezos says something about the enduring nature of Walmart.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh? What was it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh? What was it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It said, "By our estimates, they'll be the first two-hundred-billion-dollar family in history to go bankrupt."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It said, By our estimates, they'll be the first two-hundred-billion-dollar family in history to go bankrupt.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: By our estimates, theyll be the first $200 billion family in history.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: (chuckles) Oh, wow. That's a bold prediction!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, wow. That's a bold prediction!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, I don't think they're *actually* going to go bankrupt, but it really emphasizes the scale of the challenge they're facing, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, I don't think they're actually going to go bankrupt, but it really emphasizes the scale of the challenge they're facing, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. It's a wake-up call for, uh, even the biggest players in retail.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. It's a wake-up call for, uh, even the biggest players in retail.
